main event: A large, orange-silver cigar-shaped object with a white-bluish tail was observed over Lometa, Texas on April 2, 1952.
interesting points: The object was tracked by radar in addition to being observed visually.
The object appeared to be handled at 300 degrees but then turned to 120 degrees before suddenly disappearing.
A large fireball was also reported in the same area.
The object was initially classified as 'Insufficient Data for Evaluation Unknown'.
The sighting lasted long enough to be observed and tracked by both visual and radar means.
sighted object: large, orange-silver cigar-shaped object with a white-bluish tail
